com.vector.cfg.util.autosar

Class AutosarUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vector.cfg.util.autosar.AutosarUtil

  • @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
public final class AutosarUtil
extends java.lang.Object

    AutosarUtil

    The class AutosarUtil is a static utility class. Its methods are not directly related to the MDF model but are useful when client code deals with AUTOSAR paths and shortnames on string basis. Some of these methods are
    • isValidShortname(String): Checks if this shortname is valid according the rules, the AUTOSAR standard defines (character set for example)
    • getLastShortname(String): Returns the last shortname of the specified AUTOSAR path
    • getFirstShortname(String): Returns the first shortname of the specified AUTOSAR path
    • getAllShortnames(String): Returns all shortnames of the specified AUTOSAR path

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllShortnamesInTheRightOrder(java.lang.String autosarPath)

        Parameters:
        autosarPath - is an absolute or relative AUTOSAR path
        Returns:

      • getFirstShortname

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getFirstShortname(java.lang.String autosarPath)
        Returns the first shortname of the specified AUTOSAR path. Relative paths are allowed (path doesn't start with '/').

        This method implements string handling only. The specified AUTOSAR path doesn't need to point to an existing object.

        Parameters:
        autosarPath -
        Returns:
        The shortname if found. If the AUTOSAR path is empty or null, this method returns null

      • getLastShortname

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getLastShortname(java.lang.String autosarPath)
        Returns the last shortname of the specified AUTOSAR path. Relative paths are allowed (path doesn't start with '/').

        This method implements string handling only. The specified AUTOSAR path doesn't need to point to an existing object.

        Parameters:
        autosarPath -
        Returns:
        The shortname if found. If the AUTOSAR path is empty or null, this method returns null

      • getLongestCommonPostfixPath

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getLongestCommonPostfixPath(java.lang.String autosarPath1,
                                                                             java.lang.String autosarPath2)
        Returns the longest common common relative path of the two specified AUTOSAR paths.

        Example

        "/MICROSAR/Can/CanGeneral" and "/AUTOSAR/Can/CanGeneral" have "Can/CanGeneral" as longest common prefix path.
        Parameters:
        autosarPath1 -
        autosarPath2 -
        Returns:

      • getObjectLinkWithoutLastElement

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getObjectLinkWithoutLastElement(java.lang.String objectLink)
        Returns the specified ObjectLink (See IModelAccess#getObejctLink()) without the last element. In other words: This method returns the AUTOSAR path of the referrable parent object. Relative paths are allowed (path doesn't start with '/').

        This method implements string handling only. The specified AUTOSAR path doesn't need to point to an existing object.

        Parameters:
        autosarPath -
        Returns:
        The reduced path if possible. If the AUTOSAR path is empty or null, this method returns null. If the removed shortname was the only one contained, this method returns the empty string.

      • getPathOfElementWithSpecificIndex

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getPathOfElementWithSpecificIndex(java.lang.String autosarPath,
                                                                                   int elementIndex)
        Returns the specified AUTOSAR path of the element with the element index (elementIndex) without the last shortname.

        This method implements string handling only. The specified AUTOSAR path doesn't need to point to an existing object.

        Parameters:
        autosarPath -
        Returns:
        The element path if possible. If the AUTOSAR path is empty or null, this method returns null. If the index does not exist in to string null is returned.

      • getPathWithoutFirstShortname

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getPathWithoutFirstShortname(java.lang.String autosarPath)
        Returns the specified AUTOSAR path without the first shortname. In other words: This method returns a relative AUTOSAR path missing the first shortname. Absolute and relative shortnames are supported as parameters here.

        This method implements string handling only. The specified AUTOSAR path doesn't need to point to an existing object.

        Parameters:
        autosarPath -
        Returns:
        The reduced path if possible. If the AUTOSAR path is empty or null, this method returns null. If the removed shortname was the only one contained, this method returns the empty string.

      • getPathWithoutLastShortname

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getPathWithoutLastShortname(java.lang.String autosarPath)
        Returns the specified AUTOSAR path without the last shortname. In other words: This method returns the AUTOSAR path of the referrable parent object. Relative paths are allowed (path doesn't start with '/').

        This method implements string handling only. The specified AUTOSAR path doesn't need to point to an existing object.

        Parameters:
        autosarPath -
        Returns:
        The reduced path if possible. If the AUTOSAR path is empty or null, this method returns null. If the removed shortname was the only one contained, this method returns the empty string.

      • getSecondLastShortname

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getSecondLastShortname(java.lang.String autosarPath)
        Returns the second last short name of the specified AUTOSAR path. This is useful, if you have the full definition of a parameter, and would like to extract the definition short name of the parent container.
        Parameters:
        autosarPath -
        Returns:

      • getShortnameTruncatedWithCrcSuffix

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getShortnameTruncatedWithCrcSuffix(java.lang.String shortName)
        Returns the passed shortname, truncated if the shortname exceeds the MAX_SHORTNAME_LENGTH and adds a CRC-Value at the end.

        If the shortname does not exceeds the length, it is returned without suffix.

        Parameters:
        shortName - the short name
        Returns:
        the short name truncated and a crc suffix

      • getUniqueChildName

        @PublishedMethod
public static java.lang.String getUniqueChildName(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> existingNames,
                                                                    java.lang.String name,
                                                                    int numDigits)
        Create unique name for given name according to already existing names. Same algorithm as IReferrableAccess.getValidShortname, but without access to MDF Objects
        Parameters:
        existingNames -
        name -
        numDigits -
        Returns:

      • isParentPath

        @PublishedMethod
public static boolean isParentPath(java.lang.String parentPath,
                                                     java.lang.String childPath)
        Returns true if the specified parent AUTOSAR path is a prefix of the specified child path and false otherwise. If the paths are equal, this method returns false too.

        Be aware that a simple string prefix check is not sufficient here because the parent path must be followed by a short-name separator ('/') in the childPath. "/MICROSAR/Can" for example is not a parent path of "/MICROSAR/CanIf/CanIfPrivateConfiguration" but "/MICROSAR/CanIf" is one.

        Parameters:
        parentPath -
        childPath -
        Returns:

      • isTechnicallyValidShortname

        @KeepSecretFromPublishedApi
public static org.eclipse.core.runtime.IStatus isTechnicallyValidShortname(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the specified short-name is valid regarding to the technical restrictions in the MDFModel about the validity of shortnames.

        The following checks are made:

        • Is the short-name null or empty?
        • Does the short-name contains invalid characters?
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:

      • isValidAutosarPath

        @PublishedMethod
public static boolean isValidAutosarPath(java.lang.String path)
        Checks if the passed path is a valid AUTOSAR path.
        • Not null
        • Not empty
        • Starts with /
        • All parts are valid shortnames
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        true, if is valid autosar path

      • isValidLinkerSymbol

        @PublishedMethod
public static boolean isValidLinkerSymbol(java.lang.String linkerSymbolValue)
        Checks if the specified short-name is a valid LinkerSymbol regarding to the AUTOSAR rules.

        The following checks are made:

        • Is the linkerSymbol null or empty?
        • Does the linkerSymbol contain invalid characters?
        • Is linkerSymbol a C-Keyword?

        See Also method ModelUtil.isValidLinkerSymbol() for LinkerCheck depending on the definition.

        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        true, if it is a valid LinkerSymbol.

      • isValidNmToken

        @KeepSecretFromPublishedApi
public static boolean isValidNmToken(java.lang.String nmtoken)
        Checks if the specified string is an NMTOKEN according to XML 1.0.

        The following checks are made:

        • Is the string null or empty?
        • Does the string contain invalid characters?
        Parameters:
        nmtoken -
        Returns:
        true, if it is a valid NMTOKEN.

      • isValidShortname

        @PublishedMethod
public static org.eclipse.core.runtime.IStatus isValidShortname(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the specified short-name is valid regarding to the AUTOSAR rules.

        The following checks are made:

        • Is the short-name null or empty?
        • Does the short-name contains invalid characters?
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
